intro: Convolvulus tricolor subsp. hortensis, commonly known as the three-color morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and trailing habit. The subspecies hortensis is particularly valued for its compact growth and suitability in garden settings.
